title: [望特區政府打救］三條MK泰國運毒面臨終身監禁

replies.msg:
販毒集團及黃金走私集團以「免費旅行」，氹「搵快錢」青少年「落疊」成為「衝關豬」。不少人視之為「筍工」，更在網上公開「行程表」呼朋喚友「有銀齊齊搵」，更散播謠言指違禁品藏在「木雕」中可避X光機，令人誤信行程安全。有網民紛紛為3名港青的犯險嘆息，其中一名涉案少女常在網上晒周遊列國和名牌的照片，其友人周二在網上留言指：「你好人，可惜被人利用了，平安回港後小心做人呀。」有警官和社工呼籲青少年切勿貪錢鋌險，販毒在香港最高可判囚終身，在一些國家更可判死刑。

據悉，其中一名涉案少女居沙田區，經常在facebook上張貼周遊列國的自拍照，包括日本東京、泰國曼谷，今年2月留言稱會由巴西前往泰國曼谷，上月1日在網上問人「有無人有興趣去10日旅行」，招收一男兩女5月9日出發往巴西，有約1萬至2萬港元酬勞。而涉案的青年據悉亦曾於沙田居住和讀書，自小父母離異，由祖母撫養成人，曾經接受社工輔導。

The Probation Officer has opined that probation supervision is hardly adequate to bring the defendant back on track and because of his psychotropic substance abuse habit, truancy, low threshold of sexual gratification and lack of motivation to work,he is not a suitable subject for a community service order, and neither probation nor community service is recommended. Also because of his drug dependency, he is not suitable for detention in a training centre, and he is considered suitable for admission to the drug addiction treatment centre. The interviewing officer opined that ‘in view of his drug taking behavior and poor self control,a period of compulsory drug addiction treatment programme coupled with statutory supervision would be appropriate for his rehabilitation’.

泰國嚴厲打撃毒品罪行，若果涉及的是海洛英、安非他命等第一類毒品，最高刑罰是死刑。如果涉及的是可卡因等第二類毒品，最高刑罰則是終身監禁。兩名台灣男子曾企圖偷運12公斤冰毒前往新西蘭，但最終被泰國當局截獲，當場被捕。

根據泰國《毒品法》，第一類毒品包括海洛英、安非他命、冰毒、搖頭丸及黑芝麻迷幻藥，任何人製造、入口或出口這類毒品，最高刑罰是終身監禁及罰款500萬泰銖（約114萬港元）。如果持有或出售一定數量的第一類毒品，最高刑罰則是死刑。 

至於第二類毒品，任何人製造、入口及出口這類毒品，最高刑罰是判囚10年及罰款100萬泰銖（約23萬港元）；若當中包括可卡因、鴉片及嗎啡，最高刑罰將增加至判囚至少20年至終身監禁，及罰款200萬至500萬泰銖（約46萬至114萬港元）。

The Probation Officer has opined that probation supervision is hardly adequate to bring the defendant back on track and because of his psychotropic substance abuse habit, truancy, low threshold of sexual gratification and lack of motivation to work,he is not a suitable subject for a community service order, and neither probation nor community service is recommended. Also because of his drug dependency, he is not suitable for detention in a training centre, and he is considered suitable for admission to the drug addiction treatment centre. The interviewing officer opined that ‘in view of his drug taking behavior and poor self control,a period of compulsory drug addiction treatment programme coupled with statutory supervision would be appropriate for his rehabilitation’.

三位事主放心啦，泰國嘅高僧打齋技術超好

Three Hong Kong citizens were arrested at Suvarnabhumi airport yesterday for allegedly carrying 12.3kg of cocaine into the country, authorities say.


They were identified as Fong Yee Ting, 19, Tung Wing Yan, 22, and Yau Kit Long, 24.
They were searched at the airport after the Office of the Narcotics Control Board (ONCB) were told by Hong Kong authorities that traffickers were carrying drugs brought from Brazil into Thailand, according to a news briefing on the arrest.
ONCB secretary-general Sirinya Sitdhichai, Customs Department director-general Kulis Sombatsiri and Narcotics Suppression Bureau (NSB) chief Sommai Kongwisaisuk attended the briefing.
The drugs were intended to later be transported to Hong Kong, the officials said.
A search of the luggage belonging to the suspects found the cocaine in secret pockets, Mr Sirinya said. The trio are charged with bringing a Type 2 drug into the country without a permit and conspiring to possess the drugs with intent to sell.
"Upon questioning the three suspects, [we found that] they were hired by a Hong Kong woman, whose name is only known as 'Ming'. They were hired for 8,000 Hong Kong dollars each, or around 40,000 baht, to carry the drug from Brazil to Thailand," said Mr Sirinya said.
The suspects told officers they were due to deliver the drug to Ming at a hotel in the Sukhumvit area, he said.
Officers believe that Ming was tipped off as she was not at the hotel and has now fled to Hong Kong.

http://m.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1263171/3-arrested-in-cocaine-bust

Three Hong Kong citizens were arrested at Suvarnabhumi airport yesterday for allegedly carrying 12.3kg of cocaine into the country, authorities say.


They were identified as Fong Yee Ting, 19, Tung Wing Yan, 22, and Yau Kit Long, 24.
They were searched at the airport after the Office of the Narcotics Control Board (ONCB) were told by Hong Kong authorities that traffickers were carrying drugs brought from Brazil into Thailand, according to a news briefing on the arrest.
ONCB secretary-general Sirinya Sitdhichai, Customs Department director-general Kulis Sombatsiri and Narcotics Suppression Bureau (NSB) chief Sommai Kongwisaisuk attended the briefing.
The drugs were intended to later be transported to Hong Kong, the officials said.
A search of the luggage belonging to the suspects found the cocaine in secret pockets, Mr Sirinya said. The trio are charged with bringing a Type 2 drug into the country without a permit and conspiring to possess the drugs with intent to sell.
"Upon questioning the three suspects, [we found that] they were hired by a Hong Kong woman, whose name is only known as 'Ming'. They were hired for 8,000 Hong Kong dollars each, or around 40,000 baht, to carry the drug from Brazil to Thailand," said Mr Sirinya said.
The suspects told officers they were due to deliver the drug to Ming at a hotel in the Sukhumvit area, he said.
Officers believe that Ming was tipped off as she was not at the hotel and has now fled to Hong Kong.

咩叫四仔？

販毒集團及黃金走私集團以「免費旅行」，氹「搵快錢」青少年「落疊」成為「衝關豬」。不少人視之為「筍工」，更在網上公開「行程表」呼朋喚友「有銀齊齊搵」，更散播謠言指違禁品藏在「木雕」中可避X光機，令人誤信行程安全。有網民紛紛為3名港青的犯險嘆息，其中一名涉案少女常在網上晒周遊列國和名牌的照片，其友人周二在網上留言指：「你好人，可惜被人利用了，平安回港後小心做人呀。」有警官和社工呼籲青少年切勿貪錢鋌險，販毒在香港最高可判囚終身，在一些國家更可判死刑。

據悉，其中一名涉案少女居沙田區，經常在facebook上張貼周遊列國的自拍照，包括日本東京、泰國曼谷，今年2月留言稱會由巴西前往泰國曼谷，上月1日在網上問人「有無人有興趣去10日旅行」，招收一男兩女5月9日出發往巴西，有約1萬至2萬港元酬勞。而涉案的青年據悉亦曾於沙田居住和讀書，自小父母離異，由祖母撫養成人，曾經接受社工輔導。
